metadata.court_name: HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI
key_issues: Here are the key legal issues:
Registration of trademark "MUSTELA" in Class 3 by plaintiff and its validity up to 2026
Registration of same mark "MUSTELA" by defendant in Class 5 for medicinal preparations
Rectification of trade mark register for removal of impugned registration
Power of High Court to rectify the Register of Trade Marks under Section 57
Withdrawal of opposition proceedings instituted by respondent
Trademarks Law - registrability and scope of protection
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary:**

The case of Laboratoires Expanscience vs. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. involves a dispute over the trademark "MUSTELA". The High Court of Delhi heard a petition under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999, seeking rectification of the register of trademarks by removal of the word mark "MUSTELA" registered in favour of Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd.

**Background:**

Laboratoires Expanscience is the proprietor of the registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 3, which stands registered with effect from August 23, 1971. In contrast, Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. had successfully registered the word mark "MUSTELA" for medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations in Class 5 vide Registration No. 1607095 on March 31, 2009.

**Legal Issues:**

The main issue in this case revolved around whether the registration of the trademark "MUSTELA" by Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. should be rectified by removing it from the register due to being identical or similar to the registered mark owned by Laboratoires Expanscience.

**Arguments:**

Laboratoires Expanscience claimed that the registration of "MUSTELA" in Class 5 by Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. was a threat to their trademark rights, since they had already registered it for non-medicated lotions and creams for skin care use in Class 3. On the other hand, Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd.

**Court Findings:**

During the hearing of the case:

*   Mr. Manish Singhal, learned Counsel for the respondent (Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd), submitted that his client was willing to give up the word mark "MUSTELA" and delete it from the Register of Trademarks.
*   The court noted this submission and directed Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. to apply for withdrawal of Opposition No. 917190 filed against Laboratoires Expanscience's registered word mark.

**Decision:**

Based on these findings, the High Court of Delhi:

    allowed the petition to rectify the Register of Trademarks by removing Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd.'s Registration No. 1607095 for the word mark "MUSTELA" registered in Class 5.
    directed the Registrar to delete and remove the impugned word mark from the Registry immediately.
    ordered that the Register of Trademarks shall be rectified accordingly.

**Outcome:**

In essence, Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. voluntarily relinquished their trademark rights over "MUSTELA", allowing the deletion of its registration and avoiding a full-blown dispute about trademark infringement or similarity of marks.

--- PAGE 1 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001175 
 C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022                                                                            Page 1 of 3  
 
   
$~5(Original) 
* 
IN  THE  HIGH  COURT  OF  DELHI  AT  NEW  DELHI 
+  
C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022 & I.A. 21088/2022 
 
LABORATOIRES EXPANSCIENCE 
 
 ..... Plaintiff 
 
 
 
 
Through: 
Mr. Rahul Beruar, Adv. 
 
 
 
 
 
versus 
 
 
SEAGULL PHARMACEUTICALS PVT LTD & ANR. 
..... Defendants 
Through: 
Mr. Manish Singhal,  Adv. for R-1 
 
 
 
CORAM: 
 
HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE C.HARI SHANKAR 
 
 
 
 
O R D E R (O R A L) 
% 
 
 
 
 
17.02.2023 
 
 
C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022 
 
1. 
This is a petition under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999.  
 
2. 
The plaintiff is the proprietor of the registered word mark 
“MUSTELA” in Class 3, in respect of “non-medicated lotion and cream 
for the care of the skin”. The said word mark “MUSTELA” stands 
registered in favour of the plaintiff with effect from 23rd August 1971 and 
is valid up to 23rd August 2026. 
 
3. 
The plaintiff is aggrieved by the registration of the word mark 
“MUSTELA” in favour of the defendant in Class 5, for medicinal and 
pharmaceutical preparations. Registration of the impugned mark was 
Digitally Signed
By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI
Signing Date:20.02.2023
12:59:57
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 2 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001175 
 C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022                                                                            Page 2 of 3  
 
   
granted to the defendant on 31st March 2009 with effect from 1st October 
2007. 
 
4. 
The petition, therefore, seeks rectification of the register of the 
trademarks by removal, therefrom, of the Registration No. 1607095 
whereby the word mark “MUSTELA” has been registered in favour of 
the defendant. 
 
5. 
Mr. Manish Singhal, learned Counsel for the respondent submits, 
on instructions, that his client is willing to give up the word mark 
“MUSTELA” and is agreeable to deletion of the mark from Registrar of 
Trade Marks and rectification of the Register, accordingly. 
 
6. 
Mr. Rahul, learned Counsel for the petitioner submits that the 
respondent has also instituted Opposition No. 917190 on 18th January 
2018 before the Registrar of Trade Marks, opposing the plaintiff’s 
registered word mark “MUSTELA”. Mr. Manish Singhal, learned 
Counsel for the respondent submits, on instructions, that his client would 
be applying for withdrawal of the said Opposition No. 917190 and would 
not be pressing the opposition. The submission is recorded.  
 
7. 
The respondent is directed to move an application before the 
learned Registrar for withdrawal of Opposition No. 917190 positively 
within a period of three weeks from today.  The learned Registrar is 
directed to take a decision on the application within one week thereof. 
 
8. 
In view thereof, nothing survives for adjudication in the present 
Digitally Signed
By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI
Signing Date:20.02.2023
12:59:57
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 3 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023/DHC/001175 
 C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022                                                                            Page 3 of 3  
 
   
petition. It stands disposed of by recording the submissions of Mr. 
Manish Singhal by which the defendant shall remain bound. 
 
9. 
Accordingly, the impugned word mark “MUSTELA”, as 
registered in favour of the defendant in Class 5 vide Registration No. 
1607095 shall stand deleted and removed from the Register of 
Trademarks. The Register of Trademarks shall stand rectified 
accordingly. 
 
10. 
The petition is allowed in the aforesaid terms. 
 
11. 
Order to be uploaded on the website of this Court within 24 hours. 
 
 
C.HARI SHANKAR, J 
 
FEBRUARY 17, 2023 
 
ar 
 
Digitally Signed
By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI
Signing Date:20.02.2023
12:59:57
Signature Not Verified

Here is a summary of the provided section from the PDF file "30. Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Phamaceuticals Ltd..pdf":

**Case Details:**

* Case Number: C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022
* Inception Date: Not explicitly mentioned, but referenced along with another case I.A. 21088/2022
* Neutral Citation Number: 2023/DHC/001175

**Parties Involved:**

* **Plaintiff:** Laboratoires Expanscience (represented by Mr. Rahul Beruar, Adv.)
* **Defendants:** Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd & Anr. (represented by Mr. Manish Singhal, Adv. for R-1)

**Background:**

The plaintiff is the proprietor of a registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 3, which stands registered since August 23, 1971, and is valid until August 2026.

**Subject Matter:**

The plaintiff has petitioned under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999 to stop registration of the same mark in favor of the defendant in Class 5 for medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations. 

**Key Findings:**

On February 17, 2023 (Digitally Signed by SUNIL SINGH NEGI on February 20, 2023), Justice C.HARI SHANKAR granted an order based on the petitioner's claim.

nodes.title: Page 1
nodes.summary:
**Source:** 30. Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Phamaceuticals Ltd..pdf (Neutral Citation Number: 2023/DHC/001175)

**Summary:**

This is a Trade Marks Act, 1999 case where Laboratories Expanscience (Plaintiff) seeks relief under Section 57 against the registration of the word mark "MUSTELA" by Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. (Defendant).

**Key Facts and Proceedings:**

* The Plaintiff is the proprietor of the registered word mark "MUSTELA" in Class 3 for non-medicated skin care products, valid until August 2026.
* The Defendant has registered the same mark in Class 5 for medicinal and pharmaceutical preparations.
* The Plaintiff moves under Section 57 of the Trade Marks Act to cancel the registration.

**Date:** February 17, 2023

**COURT:** High Court of Delhi at New Delhi (Coram: Hon'ble Mr. Justice C.Hari Shankar)

tree_structure.title: Facts and Arguments
tree_structure.summary:
**Case Summary**

The High Court of Delhi at New Delhi heard the case Laboratories Expanscience (plaintiff) v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd., & Anr. (defendants). The case involved a trademark dispute between the parties.

**Facts:**

* Registration No. 1607095 was granted to defendant Seagull Pharmaceuticals on March 31, 2009, with effect from October 1, 2007.
* Defendant agreed to give up the word mark "MUSTELA" and delete it from the Register of Trade Marks.

**Arguments:**

* Plaintiff sought rectification of the trademark register by removing the registration for "MUSTELA".
* Defendant was willing to withdraw its opposition to plaintiff's registered word mark "MUSTELA".

**Decisions:**

* Court directed defendant to move an application before the Registrar for withdrawal of Opposition No. 917190 within three weeks.
* Registrar was directed to take a decision on the application within one week.

**Parties and Dates:**

* Plaintiff: Laboratories Expanscience
* Defendant: Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd. (and another)
* Registration date: March 31, 2009 (original registration); January 18, 2018 (opposition filed)

**Document Source:** "30. Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Phamaceuticals Ltd..pdf"

**Note:** The court's order was digitally signed on February 20, 2023.

Here is a summary of page 2 from PDF 30. Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd.

**Case details:**

* Case No.: CO (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022 & IA 21088/2022
* Court: High Court of Delhi at New Delhi
* Citation: 2023/DHC/001175

**Proceedings and submissions:**

* The plaintiff, Laboratories Expanscience, seeks rectification of the register of trademarks by removing registration no. 1607095 (word mark "MUSTELA") in favor of the defendant.
* Mr. Manish Singhal, counsel for the respondent (Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd), submits that his client is willing to give up the word mark "MUSTELA" and delete it from the registrar's register.

**Agreements:**

* The respondent agrees to withdraw Opposition No. 917190 filed on January 18, 2018.
* The court directs the respondent to file an application for withdrawal within three weeks and the learned Registrar to take a decision within one week thereof.

**PDF source:** Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd., CO (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022 & IA 21088/2022 (pdf, page 2 of 3).

tree_structure.title: Decision and Orders
tree_structure.summary:
**PDF Source:** Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Pharmaceuticals Ltd., Doc ID: 30. Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Phamaceuticals Ltd..pdf

**Decision and Orders Section:**

This section of the court order is from a trademark dispute case between Laboratories Expanscience (plaintiff) and Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd (defendant).

**Court Details:**

* Case Number: C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 793/2022
* Application Number: I.A. 21088/2022
* Neutral Citation Number: 2023/DHC/001175
* Court Location: High Court of Delhi, New Delhi

**Key Findings and Decisions:**

On February 17, 2023, the Hon'ble Court, presided by Justice C.HARI SHANKAR, delivered its decision in favor of Laboratories Expanscience.

* The impugned word mark "MUSTELA" registered by Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd (Registration No. 1607095) was held to be invalid and was ordered to be deleted from the Register of Trademarks.
* The Court rectified the Register of Trademarks accordingly, allowing Laboratories Expanscience's petition.

**Parties:**

* Plaintiffs: Laboratories Expanscience
	+Represented by Mr. Rahul Beruar, Adv.
* Defendants:
	+ Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd (R-1)
	+ Represented by Mr. Manish Singhal, Adv.

**Dates:**

* February 17, 2023: Court delivered its decision
* 20.02.2023 (12:59:57): Digitally signed by SUNIL SINGH NEGI

This court order highlights the importance of careful consideration when registering trademarks to avoid potential disputes and unauthorized use of similar marks.

nodes.title: Page 3
nodes.summary:
Here is a summary of page 3 from the PDF:

**Source:** Laboratories Expanscience v. Seagull Phamaceuticals Ltd..pdf (30 pages)

**Court Decision:**

* The High Court of Delhi at New Delhi (Justice C.Hari Shankar) disposed of the petition on February 17, 2023.
* The defendant's impugned word mark "MUSTELA" (Registration No. 1607095 in Class 5) was ordered to be deleted and removed from the Register of Trademarks.

**Order:**

* The Register of Trademarks shall be rectified accordingly.
* The petition was allowed as per the terms mentioned above (pages 1-2).

**Parties:**

* Plaintiff: Laboratoires Expanscience
* Defendant: Seagull Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd and its advocate, Mr. Manish Singhal.

Note: Page 3 of the PDF is a continuation of the order on page 2. The digital signature and verification details are also mentioned on this page.

1607095 shall stand deleted and removed from the Register of
